meanings.definition: To make a short, sharp sound, as a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The car tooted loudly as it passed by.
meanings.sent2: She tooted the horn to get the attention of the pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tooted his toy horn and giggled.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock tooted, waking her up abruptly.
meanings.sent5: The train tooted its horn before departing the station.

meanings.definition: To sound a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The ship tooted its horn to signal its arrival.
meanings.sent2: He tooted the whistle to start the race.
meanings.sent3: The referee tooted the whistle, stopping the game.
meanings.sent4: The train tooted its horn, echoing through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The bus driver tooted the horn to alert the passengers.

meanings.definition: To make a sound resembling that of a horn or whistle.
meanings.sent1: The wind tooted through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent2: The teapot tooted softly when the water boiled.
meanings.sent3: The puppy tooted a playful sound while chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The old radio tooted static before finally tuning in.
meanings.sent5: The bird tooted a melodious tune in the early morning.
